name: Aqua Waikiki Pearl

reviews.text: Before my trip to Honolulu for Christmas I read many mixed reviews on the Pearl and was a bit leary. I have stayed at several of the Aqua resorts during business trips in the past. By far I put the Aqua Waikiki Pearl at the top of my list. Not only is it affordable for a family or business the service was exceptional. Chris the security guy was the coolest! The staff from front desk to maid service were always with the Aloha spirit.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: There are many complaints about the noise levels in the surrounding areas. If you have never been to the honolulu area it is literally the concrete jungle as the locals call it. Expect street noise, expect the "ladies of the night" to be roaming the streets, yes all the streets not just Kuhio street. Unless you are staying at a hotel facing the beach and are on the 20th plus floor, ANY hotel you stay at will have some noise. My family and I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, room 502, when my wife and I were in the master bedroom at night we could hear nothing with the door closed to the living area. My 13 yr old daughter slept on the pull out couch and said she only heard the trash truck at 8am... time to get your butt up lazy teenager( lol). Dont expect a view at all and again for those hotels that have a view/partial view/city view, you will pay for it.
reviews.title: Once again, a happy guest at the Pearl.

reviews.text: The location is great. took my family 6 mins to walk to the beach with all the boogie boards and mats (PROVIDED BY THE FRONT DESK). The international marketplace is less than 100 yds from the hotel entrance. Because parking in Honolulu is hard to come by I called ahed to the hotel (about a month early) and reserved my parking for my arrival which they had waiting when we rolled in at 1am.
reviews.title: What a great room with fabulous customer service.

reviews.text: Good job Pearl team! You were all awesome
reviews.title: Our Family's Great getaway to Waikiki

reviews.text: My family and I have been visiting Waikiki since '97, often 3-4 times per year. This trip included my husband, 70, our son, 17, and me -- I'm nearly 50 and a flight attendant who stays in hotels good and bad all over the world. We have stayed at this hotel under at least three different owners since '97.
reviews.title: I would recommend this Hotel to EVERYONE I know...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and daughter-in-law gave my husband and me a six-night and seven-day all-expense-paid vacation to Hawaii for our 24th wedding anniversary (October 26th). The room we originally had was too small for us and it had no view. We wanted a room with the city view since we were going to be there for a week and we were willing to sacrifice spending money to be totally comfortable. I called the hotel about two weeks before our departure date and spoke with the manager, Kalei Lyman and asked if we could upgrade our room. He checked the computer for availability and said yes. However, because it was our 24th wedding anniversary, he waived the upgrade fee.
reviews.title: The manager, Kalei Lyman, was very accommodating.

reviews.text: We were so touched by Mr. Lyman generosity because even though all we had to have for our vacation was spending money, we struggled with even that because we are putting a daughter through college. Mr. Lyman didn't know that.
reviews.title: renovated room is good value for money for a budget traveller

reviews.text: Not having to pay the additional fee made - what we consider - a signicant difference in the amount of spending money we had. Mr. Lyman was a true blessing to us and we want to pause today to say, "Thank you" for having him as a manager. He represented the company well. We would definitely stay at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl again when we visit Hawaii; even if we have to pay full price.
reviews.title: We left!

reviews.text: There's no way we could repay him for his generosity at a time when it counted most. Therefore, we've asked God to.
reviews.title: really good Value for the money!

reviews.text: If you need to contact us, here is our contact information:
reviews.title: At Aqua Waikiki Pearl, service and cleanliness rule the day!

reviews.text: I definitely would recommend this hotel to my family, friends, and colleagues. location wise it was ideal as it was close to everything. The rates were very reasonable, I was immediately impressed by the hotel staff always so friendly and helpful. the manager on duty during my stay was Mike Singh answered all my questions and was very courteous and welcoming. Overall I had a great stay and I plan on staying there again on my next trip to Oahu. :-)
reviews.title: Great Location Great Hotel Staff

reviews.text: As the title said, this place is a great value. Staff is great. Close to the beach and anything else you may need. People whine about noise, but that's Waikiki. You want quiet, find a retirement villa in Mexico.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Also, we found a pretty great shuttle service. Pay round trip and John at Paradise won't let you down.
reviews.title: exellent

reviews.text: went to hawaii for work and brought my wife and daughter.room was extremely clean and beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows.hotel staff was great,everyone at the front desk was on top of any thing we asked about and were very friendly.made our stay very enjoyable.located right across from international marketplace it is right in the middle of everything
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl for three nights and found it to be excellent. We were lucky enough to be given a newly refurbished three bedroom suite which was massive! Three decent sized bedrooms with two bathrooms, large living area, huge kitchen with up to date appliances and a patio with a good view. The cleanliness and service at the Aqua Waikiki Pearl was of high quality and as far as price is concerned, it was definitely excellent value for money. We look forward to staying there again!!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because it seemed to be one of the few that offered space for our family of 4. The last vacation we took we were crammed into a 10x12 foot room and we were miserable, so this hotel offered a 2 bedroom with full kitchen and almost 1000 square feet. So, space we did get, but not much else. We really only had 1 bedroom and the other bedroom was a bed behind a curtain. We had 1 T.V. The full kitchen was a joke. We had a mini coffee maker, 2 burners, a small fridge and a microwave. Dishes-only a few-flatware-only a few. Pans-just the bare minimum of everything. Good thing we did not really cook. It would have been grossly inadequate for that. Oh-it did come with roaches-babies-lots of them. When we checked in we had a a full garbage can in the kitchen of someone elses garbage and 1 bath towel for 4 people. We had to ask for everything. Nothing was provided without effort on our part. We were told we had complimentary coffee provided every day and as much as we wanted. Well, it depends on who you ask. The maid does not provide it so we would have to ask down at the desk and by day 3 we were told that we get 1 packet for free and that is it. Now, we were 4 people with a mini coffee maker, so we needed 2 packets of coffee to give each person in our party a cup of coffee in the morning. We all had to share one bathroom, but we managed with that. Upon our arrival, we could not get into the buiding because they lock the entry door at 10pm. We read about that ahead of time online and called them to inquire about this and they assured us that the door will be open for us even at the late hour of our arrival. Well, it wasn't, so we had to follow someone in who had a key. We asked for a room on a high floor since we had read online that the garbage trucks wake people up because thay are so noisy. The check in went smoothly. As for the maid service-well sometimes we had it and sometimes we didn't. They work on "island time." In other words, whenever they get there and when they get there they only make the beds. We asked at the desk and left a note and a tip for the maid to clean our floors and vacuum as they were not clean upon our arrival. Well, the tip was gone but the same trash, leftovers, dirt and toe nail clippings were still on the floor. We were instructed to place our used towels on the floor so the maid would know which ones were used, but when we left to go out for the day and we returned, the maid had not come yet and now all our towels were on the dirty floor and not able to be used, so again we would go down to the desk to get new ones. They are definitely used to this because they seem to keep extra of everything at the desk and will accommodate you for any request. But to have to ask for everything is a lot of expended effort while on vacation. Oh-as for the garbage trucks, oh yes, they woke us up every morning except Christmas and Sunday between 6am and 7am, even though we on the 9th floor, we could hear them perfectly. We eventually began sleeping with ear plugs!! The building is old and according to my inspector husband-displays a lot of construction errors! So, what good can I say-Well, the room had about 1000 square feet give or take and the hotel was near a lot of things. The beach was a 2 block walk, but we knew that before we came. No one knew the hotel by name because it has changed name so many times-including our cab driver from the airport-so I gave him the address. They were nice enough to print our boarding passes for us at the desk although not without sarcasm and negative inferences regarding mine and my daughters intelligence. The hotel had a bar but nothing else. We had no car so we did not have the parking issue. We managed well with "the bus," as it was cheap and easy to use. I bought a package hotel and airfare combo but I would not do that again as I shudder to think of how much I really paid for this hotel. I would definitely stay at a well known hotel next time and have more ammenities available like pool, restaurants, hot tub, service, etc. This was definitely a "no frills" hotel, but not at a "no frills" price!
reviews.title: Only the bare minimum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel last minute because our trip to Madrid was very disappointingly canceled. My fiance used to live in Honolulu, and we love the islands, so travel here often.
reviews.title: Good for last minute...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aqua Waikiki Pearl has been renovated, but they really need to work on the outside as well. It can use some plants and/or flowers outside (maybe benches). We had the standard room with 2 beds. It was ok, however, because it did not face the street, we never had our curtains open. Although the room has a one way window, it felt really uncomfortable having people constantly walking by.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff

reviews.text: One of the big negatives with the hotel is the noise!! The cleaning staff talk very loudly and doors are constantly slamming from the employee rooms and guest rooms. Sounds are magnified because of the echoes that carry throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic people, fantastic location !

reviews.text: In terms of location, yes, it is right by Waikiki, but this is NOT the safest location. Prostitutes walk right outside (on Kuhio Ave.) and Legends is a "burly" bar right downstairs (not the coolest place to hang out).
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the worst room I ever had in waikiki.
reviews.title: Pearl, what pearl?

reviews.text: A tiny, very basic room without even a table or chair.
reviews.title: Service is astounding. Won't find any place better!

reviews.text: A tiny little window and that's it.
reviews.title: Nice location, nice people, nice stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could hear every noise next door.
reviews.title: Excellent for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a word Yuk
reviews.title: Okay...

reviews.text: We had a group of six adults. I had made the reservations and of course was nervous about the hotel. I definately have to say that it was what I expected. The reviews were pretty truthful. We had a 2 bedroom suite and another single room. The 2 bedroom suite wasn't really 2 bedrooms. The 2nd bedroom was an extension of the living room with a curtain you could pull across, which worked for us. The hotel was located just a short walk to the beach. Close to reataurants and shopping. We were only staying for 2 days before getting on a 7 day cruise and for 2 days on our return before flying back home. If the vacaation had been on the island we would have not chosen this hotel. We would have liked a pool also. The hotel was definately clean and would reccommend it for anyone that is traveling through like we were. The staff were wonderful especially a customer service rep named Harry. He was very friendly and helpful. Certainly went out of his way to treat everyone great.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the location and value

reviews.text: We stayed in 3 different hotels in honolulu on our trip but this was the best. Cute breezy lobby with super comfortable couches. Pretty nice staff (besides one creepy guy). The rooms included nice artwork, extra pillows, spacious bathroom, flat screen tv, etc. It was very relaxing. Good location near lots of shops & restaurants. About a 4 block walk to the beach. It was very quiet besides some rude boys next door to us who kept slamming the door. Overall I would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: Walking distance to the main strip, International Market place, Waikiki Beach. Our room was spacious and clean with a lovely big verandah. The rest of our group were not so lucky as they found their rooms a bit dirty and smelly. The hotel looks as though it has been recently refurbed and will be even better than when I stayed. Don't expect anything too flash but this was a great budget place in a bustling location.
reviews.title: Great location and quality on a budget

reviews.text: My travelling companion and I stayed here for 4 nights and there is nothing to complain about. We got an ultra chap rate and were very happy at the end of our stay. The hotel has been recently renovated, the rooms are quite large (we had two doubles), air-conditioned and clean. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and the hotel staff were unbelievably helpful. We were on the 7th floor I think and didn't have any problems with noise as mentioned in other posts.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel for a Good Price.

reviews.text: Only downside is that it is a few blocks off the main waikiki strip, but you should know this already if you do any research before you book.
reviews.title: Economic & clean hotel located at the center of Waikiki!

reviews.text: Perfect setup if:
reviews.title: For early 2011 timeframe, best value hands down

reviews.text: -you are traveling with 2/3 friends and splitting the room price (standard room sleeps 3- one double, one queen)
reviews.title: Homely feel Hotel

reviews.text: -you want to stay somewhere central (room is very close to the beach and across from the International Marketplace).
reviews.title: Great Place for the Price

reviews.text: -you wont be spending a lot of time in your room but want something decent sized
reviews.title: Easy place to stay in Waikiki!

reviews.text: Rooms are the biggest and most modern Ive seen for the price.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: The hotel were efficient with my online booking. I had a city view room which was huge with one king size bed. Unfortunately the room had a very large window which overlooked the room access walkway, so I had to have the curtain closed the whole time. I could have been is a dark windowless room !
reviews.title: Good location, characterless hotel

reviews.text: The hotel had a free high speed ethernet connection in each room and had a free Apple laptop on a stand in the reception area for those without a laptop.
reviews.title: 2 thumbs up

reviews.text: Very good location in the very middle of Kuhio - the main bus route. It is surrounded by shops and restaurants and only a short walk to waikiki beach.
reviews.title: Second visit to the Aqua Waikiki Pearl

reviews.text: The rooms are huge but completely characterless - The rates fluctuated drastically by the day. On a few days, the room rate hit luxury hotel levels and this is definitely only a budget hotel.
reviews.title: Business Excellence

reviews.text: stayed in this very affordable hotel and staff are incredibly friendly. the moment i arrived at the hotel i was greeted with a smile and staff are very eager to help with my questions. would totally go back in the same hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Value but Noisy

description: The Aqua Waikiki Pearl is a renovated mid-rise hotel located in the heart of Waikiki, near the shops and restaurants of the famous International Marketplace. Located just 2 blocks to Waikiki Beach, this comfortable hotel offers spacious accommodations, large balconies in most rooms and offers the following FREE amenities: in-room Internet and WiFi Internet access in the lobby, local calls and in-room safe. Hotel rooms offer a refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker and full kitchens in suites. On-site there is also Legends, a lively sports bar with multi-screen TV’s, as well as various retail shops and services.
